titlestmt.titleproper: Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. Downtown Brooklyn photographs and negatives V1990.015
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T15:49-0500

did.unittitle: Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. Downtown Brooklyn photographs and negatives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. Downtown Brooklyn photographs and negatives date from 1990 and consist of 33 items. Images show abandoned buildings and houses, as well as a group of attached row houses being moved within Downtown Brooklyn. The collection also includes images of married officer housing at the Brooklyn Navy Yard (formally known as the New York Naval Shipyard).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: All items will enter the public domain 70 years after the death of the photographer. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr., 1990.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Dwight B. Demeritt, Jr. Downtown Brooklyn photographs and negatives, V1990.015, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
